content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: An interesting exercise for string manipulation. The problem statement is clear, and it involves some fun challenges related to encryption and key rotation.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: The statement is clear, precise and well structured. A good exercise in string manipulation and algorithmic logic.

However, pay attention to the names of the tests in capital or non-capital form. Test number 2 is the only one with a capital letter.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: A nice take on the VigenÃ¨re cipher. Solvable in well under 5 minutes, partly thanks to the simple use of only uppercase letters and the ignoring of spaces. Original enough for a clash, fun to solve.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

I'm terribly sorry, but I simply cannot fathom dedicating my precious time to peruse such an extensive and cumbersome block of text, as it would undoubtedly clash with my refined sensibilities. Might I humbly request a more succinct version?

General
* There's a similar clash. The main difference between the two clashes is the treatment of space characters.
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/143177fb101b6f905734094193bb1a33c5ef

Goal
* Please fix the typo: "lenght" => "length".

* Please un-format "plaintext" and "key" which are formatted as a [[variable]] for the second time (treat them as general terms, like what you did for the other instances of "plaintext" and "key" which you had already left unformatted).

* Please add ", wrapping around at the end of the alphabet as necessary." after "and so on". Remember to add the full-stop.

* Please format "NOTHING" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks around the word.

Output
* Please fix the typo: "encryptet" => "encrypted".

* Please add "or {{NOTHING}}".

Cases
* The case of "NOTHING" is covered by 1 test but 0 validator. Please change Validator 3 so that its required output is changed to "NOTHING".

Thanks.

Changed everything, thanks.
Is there any way for making sure to not create a duplicate, or did you just know by chance?
I don't want to "steal" someone's idea.

And thanks for pointing out the typos... I'm not native-speaking...
I'm sure there are longer clash statements than this one, and I feel the statement here is as succinct as possible already. The author may confirm whether they agree with me.

However, if I may suggest employing the practice of paragraphing, as it lends an air of sophistication and elegance to the text, surpassing the visual displeasure of encountering an undifferentiated block of words.
And if you feel inclined, please consider to portray to me where you'd like to relieve the text for the sake of readability of some words you would refrain from.

Thank you for your prompt reply and follow-up.

Regarding how to search for duplicates:

The official way is to search the titles here:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/community
(Change the filter from "Pending" to "Accepted" first. Some users said they couldnâ€™t find that menu, so it seems that youâ€™ve got to reach a certain condition before you gain access.)

Another way is to use the unofficial tool made by a fellow CodinGame player:
https://codingame.tools/

The third way is to write your own code to read and search CG's clash database.

Regarding typos:

The simplest way is to run a spell-checker ðŸ˜‰

Definitely write that link down somewhere.
Because lazyness * 0.25 + no proficiency = no own tool.
Thank you very much!
